subject: AgitarOne - JUnit Generation

Hi

I have just had a brief presentation of AgitarOne ... and all the
One-liners aside, I was impressed with the additional features,
especially the JUnit generation.

From what I saw of the generation capabilities, it seemed to be a good
way to attack legacy code and also supplement existing TDD practices.

I particularly liked the way it expressed a test (and this is from a
brief glance and my memory) for the products contained in an order,
using a helper it took the collection and returned a string result
which the test then asserted.  Something like:

assert_equal "10 nuts, 10 bolts, 2 hinges", helper.method(order.products)

which I thought was incredibly readable.

Like for another test it created a string something like
"19Charactersxxxxxxx", which again was nice and readable.

It also generated exception tests.  It did however test the expected
message which I think some people like to do and some do not.  Going
forward it would be nice to see this type of decision configurable if
possible.

In case I am out of  touch though, I am not aware of any other product
with this level of sophistication, am I correct?

Cheers
Shane

-- 
Shane Mingins
